page.title: 02High St.,Gt.Ayton + Area.
page.content: This is the lower part of the High Street,away from the true central business district of the village, so there are more houses than shops, though these latter include the Riverside Wine Lodge (an off-licence), an estate agent that also acts for the Halifax Building Society, a bookshop, a butcher, a cafe, a hairdresser, a newsagent and a Do-It-Yourself wood and materials shop. The street is narrow and residents' parking of cars causes traffic congestion. A Congregational chapel has been converted to residential use, but most houses are 18th. or 19th. century brick with pantile or slate roofs, built in terraces. The High Street runs along the north side of the River Leven, to the south of which 'sheltered' accomodation is provided for old people.
